summary: Completed frontend testing of the new Acetaminophen (Paracetamol) Approach feature in Children > Approaches section. All 5 test cases passed successfully.
passed_tests: Acetaminophen Overdose option appears in the dropdown on Children > Approaches page (alphabetically sorted)
Clicking on 'Acetaminophen Overdose' renders the AcetaminophenApproach component correctly
Rumack-Matthew Nomogram SVG renders correctly with treatment line (orange), probable toxicity line (red dashed), axes, grid lines, and legend
NAC dosing calculator works when weight is entered - correctly calculates 3-bag IV protocol (150mg/kg loading, 50mg/kg bag2, 100mg/kg bag3), 2-bag protocol, and oral protocol

Risk assessment calculator shows results when hours and serum level are entered - correctly identifies toxic ingestion (200 mg/kg for 5000mg/25kg) and nomogram result (above treatment line at 6h with 120 mcg/mL)
Search functionality works with 'acetaminophen' keyword - auto-selects Acetaminophen Overdose
Search functionality works with 'paracetamol' keyword - auto-selects Acetaminophen Overdose
Component displays all clinical phases of toxicity (Phase I-IV)
Component displays toxic dose thresholds (acute single ingestion ≥150 mg/kg, chronic/repeated ≥150 mg/kg/day)
Component displays high risk patient information
Initial Management section displays correctly (decontamination, labs, poison control)
NAC protocols section displays indications for NAC treatment
critical_code_review_comments: AcetaminophenApproach component is well-structured with proper separation of concerns
Rumack-Matthew Nomogram SVG implementation is correct with proper scaling and interpolation
NAC dosing calculations correctly implement 3-bag, 2-bag, and oral protocols with max dose caps
Risk assessment calculator correctly uses linear interpolation for nomogram threshold calculation
data-testid attributes properly implemented: approach-selector, tab-acetaminophen, approaches-weight-input, approaches-search
Component properly receives weight prop from parent ApproachesPage and uses it for calculations
context_for_next_testing_agent: Acetaminophen Approach feature is fully functional in Children > Approaches section. Navigation: Login > Dashboard > Children card > Approaches card > Select 'Acetaminophen Overdose' from dropdown. The component includes Rumack-Matthew Nomogram SVG, Risk Assessment Calculator (Amount Ingested, Hours Post-Ingestion, Serum Level), NAC dosing protocols (3-bag IV, 2-bag IV, oral), and clinical information. Search works with keywords: acetaminophen, paracetamol, tylenol, overdose, nac, n-acetylcysteine, rumack, nomogram, hepatotoxicity, liver, poisoning.
